channel.title: Slayer
channel.description:
Can anyone tell me how I would change the slayer exp given by each monster when on a slayer task? I'm on a Deltascape base and want to speed up slayer.
Thanks in advance.
Also, if anyone has the "Hail" command, where everyone bows to the owner, on their server; can you post it here, please?
Also, also; if anyone knows how I can make a command to complete all quests simultaniously, that would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: Slayer
item.dc:creator: @mad_Man_Joe mad Man Joe
item.description:
@mad_Man_Joe wrote:

Full Metalst:

If this is a 317, then I highly suggest you make the [quote]sM[/quote] a sendMessage

The sM works just fine, the message is sent as it’s supposed to.

I just tried spawning a rat (id 87) rather than the id 86 ones I have been killing. It worked and I got my slayer exp. So now I’m going through each task and changing the autospawn.

This is thanks to King Redrum, he pointed out what was wrong.

Note: I STILL NEED HELP WITH THE QUEST AND HAIL COMMANDS.

Read full topic

item.title: Slayer
item.dc:creator: @mad_Man_Joe mad Man Joe
item.description:
@mad_Man_Joe wrote:

[quote=“Full Metalst, post:8, topic:248115”]AddSkillXP

Add that in your Slayer codes.[/quote]

It is in there. See.

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1153 && temp.taskID == 1153) { temp.addSkillXP(1500, 18); temp.taskAmount -= 1; if (temp.taskAmount == 0 || temp.taskAmount == 1) { temp.taskID = -1; temp.taskAmount = -1; temp.sM("You have completed your task. Talk to Vannaka to get a new one."); } }[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 01, 2008, 08:14:13 pm[/size][hr]Why does it seem my topics never get resolved.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Full_Metalst wrote:

AddSkillXP

Add that in your Slayer codes.

Read full topic

item.title: Slayer
item.dc:creator: @mad_Man_Joe mad Man Joe
item.description:
@mad_Man_Joe wrote:

[quote=“King Redrum, post:6, topic:248115”]Make sure in the client.java task section the NPC ID he gives is the same as the ID that gives XP. Example:

public int[] lowTask = { 87, 100, 19, 1267, 181, 90, 112, 117, 78, 1153, 1626 };

You notice that in the lowTask section, the 1626 is another type of Turoth, while in the NPChandler:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1626 && temp.taskID == 1153) { temp.addSkillXP(150, 18); temp.taskAmount -= 1; if (temp.taskAmount == 0 || temp.taskAmount == 1) { temp.taskID = -1; temp.taskAmount = -1; temp.sM("You have completed your task. Talk to Vannaka to get a new one."); } }
The NPCID 1627, (Turoth) gives slayer XP.

That’s just an example. I know on my delta source slayer XP works fine o_O.[/quote]

That helped, I understand what’s wrong now, thank you.
But I’m still not sure as to how I go about fixing this problem. Will I need to completely change all the NPC IDs in both my client and NPCHandler to match the NPCs in-game?
Could you perhaps post your own working slayer codes from both client and NPCHandler?
I would be very greatful.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 01, 2008, 07:54:21 pm[/size][hr]I guess not.

Read full topic

item.title: Slayer
item.dc:creator: @King_Redrum King Redrum
item.description:
@King_Redrum wrote:

Make sure in the client.java task section the NPC ID he gives is the same as the ID that gives XP. Example:

public int[] lowTask = { 87, 100, 19, 1267, 181, 90, 112, 117, 78, 1153, 1626 };

You notice that in the lowTask section, the 1626 is another type of Turoth, while in the NPChandler:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1626 && temp.taskID == 1153) { temp.addSkillXP(150, 18); temp.taskAmount -= 1; if (temp.taskAmount == 0 || temp.taskAmount == 1) { temp.taskID = -1; temp.taskAmount = -1; temp.sM("You have completed your task. Talk to Vannaka to get a new one."); } }
The NPCID 1627, (Turoth) gives slayer XP.

That’s just an example. I know on my delta source slayer XP works fine o_O.

Read full topic

item.title: Slayer
item.dc:creator: @mad_Man_Joe mad Man Joe
item.description:
@mad_Man_Joe wrote:

Thank you, but I just realised I have a problem.
When my character kills his intended monster from a slayer task, he gains no slayer exp and his task doesn’t decrease.

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1153 && temp.taskID == 1153) { temp.addSkillXP(1500, 18); temp.taskAmount -= 1; if (temp.taskAmount == 0 || temp.taskAmount == 1) { temp.taskID = -1; temp.taskAmount = -1; temp.sM("You have completed your task. Talk to Vannaka to get a new one."); } }

That is my slayer code for each creature, is something wrong with it?

Read full topic
